channel.title: Tele into wildy
channel.description: Ok, so I have a zenith 667 loading 718 source, and when you teleport someone into the wildy, they aren't attackable, because they haven't manually jumped over the ditch... How can I fix it so when I teleport someone into the wildy, they are actually attackable?

item.title: Tele into wildy
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“Camballer, post:6, topic:467252”][quote]if (cmd[0].equalsIgnoreCase(“teletome”) && player.getRights() == 7) {
String username = cmd[1].substring(cmd[1].indexOf(" ") + 1);
Player other = World.getPlayerByDisplayName(username);
player.getControlerManager().startControler(“Wilderness”);
if (other == null)
return true;
other.setNextWorldTile(player);
other.stopAll();
return true;
}[/quote]
Didn’t work. :l[/quote]

You’re making yourself do that. You are player and the player you’re teleporting to you is other. So change the ‘player’ to ‘other’ and I also don’t understand why you need to teleport anybody into the wilderness…

Read full topic

If your teleporting people into the wilderness you shouldn’t own a server.

Add that into your teletome command or, again, if you’re unsure, post your teletome command.

item.title: Tele into wildy
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

[quotepackage com.rs.game.player.dialogues;

import com.rs.cache.loaders.ObjectDefinitions;
import com.rs.game.Animation;
import com.rs.game.ForceMovement;
import com.rs.game.WorldObject;
import com.rs.game.WorldTile;
import com.rs.game.tasks.WorldTask;
import com.rs.game.tasks.WorldTasksManager;

public class WildernessDitch extends Dialogue {

private WorldObject ditch;

@Override
public void start() {
	ditch = (WorldObject) parameters[0];
	player.getInterfaceManager().sendInterface(382);
}

@Override
public void run(int interfaceId, int componentId) {
	if (interfaceId == 382 && componentId == 19) {
		player.stopAll();
		player.addStopDelay(4);
		player.setNextAnimation(new Animation(6132));
		final WorldTile toTile = new WorldTile(player.getX(),
				ditch.getY() + 2, ditch.getPlane());
		player.setNextForceMovement(new ForceMovement(
				new WorldTile(player), 1, toTile, 2, 0));
		final ObjectDefinitions objectDef = ditch.getDefinitions();
		WorldTasksManager.schedule(new WorldTask() {
			@Override
			public void run() {
				player.setNextWorldTile(toTile);
				player.setNextFaceWorldTile(new WorldTile(ditch
						.getCoordFaceX(objectDef.getSizeX(),
								objectDef.getSizeY(), ditch.getRotation()),
						ditch.getCoordFaceY(objectDef.getSizeX(),
								objectDef.getSizeY(), ditch.getRotation()),
						ditch.getPlane()));
				player.getControlerManager().startControler("Wilderness");
			}
		}, 2);
	} else
		player.closeInterfaces();
	end();
}

@Override
public void finish() {

}

}
][/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Tele into wildy
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Take whatever the ‘jumping over the ditch’ method is doing to initialize your state of being inside the wilderness and paste it in the teletome command. If you’re incapable of doing that, at least find the ‘jumping over the ditch’ method and post it here.

Read full topic
